meanings.definition: Having only the most basic or essential elements; stripped down to the bare bones.
meanings.sent1: The bareboned chair had no cushions or armrests, just a simple wooden frame.
meanings.sent2: The room was furnished in a bareboned style, with only a table and two chairs.
meanings.sent3: The bareboned picnic basket contained only a loaf of bread and a jar of jam.
meanings.sent4: Her bareboned explanation left out all the interesting details, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent5: The bareboned tree stood alone in the field, its branches stripped of leaves.

meanings.definition: A bareboned account of the facts; without any additional details or embellishments.
meanings.sent1: The detective's report was a bareboned summary of the crime scene evidence.
meanings.sent2: The journalist's article provided a bareboned overview of the political scandal.
meanings.sent3: The bareboned news report left out all the juicy gossip, much to the disappointment of the readers.
meanings.sent4: Her resume was a bareboned list of qualifications, lacking any personal anecdotes.
meanings.sent5: The bareboned map showed only the main roads, leaving out smaller streets and landmarks.
